intro: Pabstiella recurviloba, commonly known as the slender leafed pabstiella, is a rare and specialized member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, slender leaves that are often recurved at the edges, giving it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or along stream banks. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
